body:
Comment 6 by **nullsquid**: 
well, with no further advance on this, I'll post my limited findings..

 _yychar is in y.tab.o, so including that in the object list of the 8g makefile
allows it to compile (not all the .o files.)

I don't know why it isn't ok being in the gc.ao library.

Mine also crashes after the gopack line. The zombie program, however, is 8.out which
I think is in 8l. So I think it may be unrelated to the weird linking in 8g. (I'm a
novice..) Interesting to note is that when the program was killed in activity monitor
the virtual memory was listed as 6 million terabytes; is there is difference in
paging between tiger and leopard? anyway, again, it seems it'd be unrelated to the
linking problem above, and one of the "unexpected 10.4 behaviors" of go in general.

But I'm a novice, so I'd appreciate some criticism..
